intro: Tuberolabium quisumbingii var. xanthum, commonly known as the yellow-flowered tuber labium, is a rare and ornamental plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, characterized by its showy, tubular flowers. The plant features bright yellow petals and a distinctive labellum, which is a specialized lip structure typical of orchids. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
